Title:
Fissuroma bambucicola sp. nov. (Aigialaceae, Pleosporales)
from Bamboo in Guizhou, China
Abstract:
A new ascomycete inhabiting decaying bamboo is introduced
based on morpho-molecular evidence. Morphologically, it is characterized
by hemispherical ascomata with slit-like ostiole, trabeculate
pseudoparaphyses, obclavate to cylindrical asci, and fusiform, hyaline,
1-septate ascospores, surrounded by a distinctive thin sheath, which is
fit well with the family Aigialaceae. Maximum likelihood and Bayesian
analyses based on a combined LSU, ITS, SSU, and TEF1-Î± sequence data
showed that the new collection is affiliated with the genus Fissuroma
and can be recognized as a new species Fissuroma bambusicola. The
comprehensive descriptions of F. bambusicola and notes on its
phylogenetic placement are provided.
